lines.text: It's this lady. What was her name- Whydah? Right, Dr. Opal Whydah.
Or, uh- no, sorry. Never mind.
...C-can I help you?
Yeah, um...
What's with that big machine you've got there?
Machine?
Yeah, that microscope-lookin' dealie.
It's- it's a microscope.
So... y-you've already identified it correctly. Good- good work.
A giant microscope? On wheels?
...Yes.
Uh. I mean, the obvious question I've got here is ''how come it's so big?''
Aren't microscopes usually conveniently desk-sized?
It's- well, when- when it's bigger, it can fit more lenses, and, um, increase the f-focal length...
Which means- which means I can see smaller things.
Hm...

choices.text: I bet it's just for show.

lines.text: What kind of things do you need to see that a regular microscope can't handle?
Um... w-well, evidence, and... tr-traces of... things...
What, like, individual molecules?
It's- ah, it's not- it's not that powerful. But...
An- an individual bact- bact- bacterium, for instance.
When do you need to get up close and personal with germs?
It- ah, well, when- when dealing with pathology cases, or, um...
Did he- did Fleini put you up to this?
Huh?
...Yyyyyyyes. This was all a weird sting operation.
To... expose you for microscope crimes.
I- you- is this...?
I wasn't sure about it, but he bribed me good, and now you're caught red-handed!
Having... a microscope that's too big!
...There's- there's n-nothing illegal about...!
Chill, dude, I know. I'm messing with you.
...Ah. D-don't.
What? No.
Put me up to what? Asking you about your microscope?
He- he hates me. He'll... d-do anything to see me gone.
I don't- I don't know what he'd accomp-accomplish, by looking into... my equipment, b-but...!
Yeah, no, I was just curious. No need to drag the boss man into it.
(Sheesh. What's with these two?)
Suuuuure. It's for looking at really really small things, that's all.
It's not some kind of power move, having a bigger microscope than everyone else.
Wh-what?
The other forensic scientists look at how big your scope is, and they're like, dang, she must be extremely science.
Extremely- what?
I bet it doesn't even do anything special! You just wanted to have a really big microscope!
I- I'm not the one being in- in- investigated, here!
Uh-huh! I got it. Your secret is safe with me.
...it's not... you're n-not even making any sense.
Not making any sense like a fox.
So... is that thing yours?
That- oh, the- um...
No, it's... I don't- I don't know what that's d-doing here.
It's just... sort of... it was chained up when I got here.
Maaaaaaaa!
So you've got nothing to do with it, huh?
A likely story!
Maaaaaaaaaaaaaaa-aa!
Wh-what?!
You've been standing right here next to that goat the whole time...
Why's that, huh?
I- I just... I'm keeping an- an eye on it, and, um... staying out of the way of-
You know what I think? I think that's baloney!
I think you and that goat are best friends!
Maaaa-aaa?
I- what?
You wanted to bring your goat friend along to work, but that wasn't allowed...
So you chained it up and pretended it was part of the crime scene!
Maaaaa!
Do you... have some sort of c-compulsion, to come up with- with ridiculous theories?
I'll thank you not to make fun of my Player Character Disease, ma'am.
So that raises the question... what is it doing here?
Leo's <c=#FF00FF>hypothesis</c> doesn't really account for the goat at all.
It's- well, that'd be b-because... it's not a crime to own a goat, r-right?
Sure, but it's still weird.
Do you have... s-some sort of guess?
Well...
I mean, it could be a magic goat, or something?
A... magic goat.
Wh-what sort of magic goat?
I'unno. Like, a goat with a spell on it, or a goat wizard.
Maa-aaaaaa?
Yeah, I mean, I don't think goats can use magic, but you never know.
Er... d-did you just talk to...?
The goat? Yeah, I speak goat. What of it?
R-really? That's- you wouldn't happen to- it's not a w-witness, is it?
Haha, nah, I'm joshing you.
That'd be really convenient, though, right? We could go home early!
C-convenient. Right.
I don't know what's up with the goat, but...
I'm sure it's got something to do with this crime, right?
There's a whole lot of weirdness going on. An inexplicable goat seems right at home.
Ah... then, sh-should we have Fleini draft a- draft an evidence card for it?
He didn't already? Huh.
Well, I'll take a look and see what I can figure out.
Could be some kinda wizard lunch, right?
M-maa?!
Y'know, like he kept a goat around to eat if he got hungry.
You know that sort of thing is, heh, on the table, right, kid?
Maaaaaaaaa!
I... I don't know if th-that's it.
Well, if the wizard isn't gonna eat it, no sense letting it go to waste.
Now where'd I put the barbecue sauce...?
Maaaaaaaaaaa!
D-don't listen to %THEM%. %CTHEYRE% just- I'm sure %THEYRE% just joking.
Joking, or hungry?
MAAAA-aaaa!
Alright, you got me.
...C-can I help you?
Yeah, um...
So... are you gonna help investigate, or no?
I, um...
I can't.
Huh? What do you mean you can't?
I mean... there's only so much f-forensic work I can do without touching anything.
I- there's- I'd help, but... the rules are the rules.
Uh...
Can you explain those ''rules'' again? Because... they kind of sound crazy.
Y-you think?
I mean, you're not allowed to touch anything? Why?
It's- it's to avoid disturbing the evidence.
What for? So that the police can investigate properly?
News flash- this is the investigation, and we ARE the police!
Or, you guys are. I'm an outside consultant.
Well- ah, y-yes. It's... fairly restrictive.
There was- um, there was a l-lawsuit, a few years ago...
A lawsuit?
Er. A, uh, citizen of... s-some wealth, sued the department for- for, um...
His possessions were, ah, d-disturbed during an investigation, and...
Well, the lawyers argued that if- if, ah, ci-civilians c-couldn't... disturb the evidence, then...
What, the cops shouldn't be allowed to either?
Not- not without a more specific warrant.
How the heck did they get the judge to rule in favor of that? That's bonkers!
I, ah... well, it w-was... the lawyers were very- very expensive.
And the judge, um... it's r-rumored he was, um, being... intim- intimidated by the plaintiff.
Wait. Citizen of some wealth... intimidating the judge... keeping the cops from investigating...
Did you guys get hoodwinked by the mafia?
Er...
In so many words.
Okay, I don't hate the rules anymore. That's hilarious.
If you can't do any work or touch anything... what are you even doing here?
It's... a forensic science technician is- is required to be on th-the scene...
That... sounds pointless, if you can't do anything.
You couldn't just stay home?
N-no, I'd- well, of course, Leo would've let me, so I'd g-get written up...
I... I insisted.
Wait. If he didn't bring a forensic tech, wouldn't he get in trouble?
And isn't that what you want?
Y-you... I don't- I don't know where you're going with this, b-but...!
Uh, I don't have any sinister theories.
It's just, hey, bureaucracy is wild, huh?
Ah... y-yes. Wild.
So... what does ''forensics'' mean? What do you actually do?
I- you d-don't know?
I don't watch a lot of crime shows, so...
I mean, I know you do... science? And that helps... figure things out?
...sigh.
I... w-well, if I was allowed to, I could ch-check objects for fingerprints, and-
Fingerprints?
...Y-you don't- you don't know what fingerprints are?
It's like, a kind of magic that lets you see who touched something, right?
It's- it's not magic. People- their fingers, they, um... leave... unique p-patterns of residue...
And, um- if you match those patterns to, to, um- to the fingers of a s-suspect...
You can see if they touched anything. Huh.
I can also, um... well, more than just f-fingers...
Suspects can leave- um, ge-genetic material behind, and... I can analyze that.
Using h-hairs, or skin, left behind... I can t-tell who was here.
Cool, cool...
That's one heck of a stage trick, without using any real magic!
Ah, um... th-thank you.
Although- although it's odd to be c-complimented for that.
No, yeah, it's real cool.
The Man won't let you cast Discern Identity, so you come up with a way around it!
Th-that's a spell?
Yeah, but it's a tough one. The ritual to get it is... pretty risky.
It sounds like this ''forensics'' stuff is safer, too.
It, ah... yes.
Yes, my line of work is... is safer than, uh, s-summoning demons.
But... I mean, we know who our suspects are. They're all right here.
So what's the point of all this identity-checking stuff?
I, um...
I mean... there's <c=#FF00FF>some reason you came,</c> right?
That's- it's- I'm...!
It's- this is just my j-job. I'm here because- because I have to be.
Oof. Same boat, huh?
...C-can I help you?
Yeah, see...
Okay, I'm wise to your tricks.
My... tricks?
Yeah! You...

choices.text: ...tried to hide what was in that book!

lines.text: Yeah! You...

lines.text: Yeah! You...
Yeah! You...
You moved that curtain to cover up the bathtub!
I- I moved- th-the curtain?
Yeah! We all saw it! It was spread just wide enough to cover the whole thing!
Y-you... you have no proof I did that.
That could- that could- that could easily have been done by one of the w-wizards!
...I guess. But would the wizards know about the police rules?
They probably wouldn't bother with that, since they didn't know we couldn't just move the drapes.
Only <c=#FF00FF>you</c> would think the curtain would hide anything from us!
Th-that's...!
You- you still can't prove that! Th-they might've done their r-reading on police procedure!
Uh-huh.
It's- there's no proof, o-okay? So... d-don't jump to conclusions!
A-and why would I do that?
Uh...
You... wanted to hide what was in the tub!
Is th-that so? And what exactly- what exactly did I hide?
The... fact that it was full of concrete!
And that's- that's relevant to the c-crime, h-how?
I, uh...
Hang on. I'll talk to Leo.
You moved Slick's coat over to cover up his wound!
O-oh? And how do you know that?
I, uh...
That- that coat could've simply... s-settled as he fell.
There's- you don't h-have reason to suspect- to suspect I t-tampered with anything!
I mean, we've got plenty of reason to suspect...
But- but you can't prove it!
...Yeah, but we both know what you did.
I- I deny your accu- your accusations.
You didn't want us to know what was on the other pages of that book!
...Wh-what do you mean? Wh-why would that matter?
You didn't want us to know they were trying to reach level 2...
You wanted us to think they were already there, so we'd get the wrong answer!
Because, um, you want to make Leo look incompetent or whatever.
I didn't t-touch that book. I- I did nothing but r-remind you of the rules.
Even if- even if y-your accusations are right, there's- I committed no crime!
...Uh, technically?
Technically!
Yeah, I guess technically technically counts...
Um...
Well, that ritual...
I feel like that's important, somehow...
Y-you don't- you have nothing.
I guess I should talk to <c=#FF00FF>Leo</c> about this one.
Okay, I don't know what you did!
But I bet you totally did something! That slip-up with the spellbooks is the smoking gun!
S-smoking gun?
I- I simply forgot. Momentarily. Y-you can't prove I did anything on purpose.
Ugh. There's gotta be something...
I guess I should <c=#FF00FF>inspect the crime scene</c> some more.
So, it sounds like you and Leo have... beef.
Y-you could say that.
Like, he said you were... his wife's ex, or something?
Y-you could certainly say that.
Or, you could say that he stole my g-girlfriend.
Uh.
Okay, jeez, I'm out of my depth here, but, um...
Well...
I guess I'm just not really seeing it.
Like, Leo? We're talking about the same guy here?
That guy couldn't charm his way out of a paper bag.
Well, obviously.
He- he...! I don't- I don't know what he did!
He just- he started talking to her, and...
And all of a sudden, she- she hated me! Just- just like that!
Uh.
So, what, are we talking brainwashing magic?
Because as hard as it is to believe he could smooth-talk a lady...
It's even harder to believe he could figure out how to work complex mind spells.
I-I wouldn't put it p-past him.
He's a- he's a buffoon, b-but... he's also s-scummy.
Scummy enough to hire black market help.
...Okay, that's even harder to believe. Leo's the biggest square I know.
(Or, octagon, but same diff.)
You- you don't know him. D-don't underestimate that man.
Uh, okay...?
Your girlfriend- uh, his wife- what's she like?
...Sh-she's...
Well, she's, um...
Y-you've met her! She's- she's the chief of police!
Wait, that was her?
You'd have to remember her. She's- she's the most beautiful woman in the world!
...Are we thinking of the same lady?
With the scars and the cigarette teeth?
That's- that's her, yes.
...No accounting for taste, I guess.
But like, what's she like? She didn't really say anything to me when she was signing off on my papers.
She- she's just... y-you don't understand.
She was mine! That- we had a bond!
Uh... okay, I'm just gonna... I'm gonna step off, here.
...C-can I help you?
Yeah, just...
So, the jig is up on the scheme to help them with their scheme...
But you'll get him next time. No hard feelings, right?
There are, actually.
H-he- you- that incompetent's only k-keeping his job thanks to dumb luck.
Dumb luck, and p-people like you, covering for his- his mistakes.
Uh...
So... hard feelings? I- I have a few.
Well...

choices.text: Go ahead and have those, then.

lines.text: About what? You didn't do anything, right?
You totally deny that you tampered with the crime scene, so...
You really don't have any basis to be mad at me, am I wrong?
Y-yes. I- absolutely. You- you did nothing wrong.
See? Everything's-
Unrelatedly? You... are dead meat.
Whoa-ho-ho! Chill, Whydah!
Okay, well, that's fair. Hard feelings ahoy.
Just, FYI, I don't super care, because I'm cool and tough and I'm not afraid of you.
I-is that so.
Yeah, dawg! I foiled your evil scheme, it was great, the end.
I'm not sorry for anything!
But we're cool, right?
...We're cool. I'm deciding we're cool.
So... is there anything else you want to tell us?
W-what do you mean?
Like, since we pretty much busted your plan wide open...
You want to maybe fill us in on the details and save us all some time?
I- I don't know what you're- what you're talking about.
I- I maintain that I did nothing to- to, ah, impede the- impede the investigation.

choices.text: So you can help us now.

lines.text: ...Seriously?
Of course.
You're really gonna pretend you didn't do anything.
Even though it's totally obvious you tampered with the crime scene.
Y-y-you've got a- a worrying lack of proof, for- for something that's supposed to be so obvious.
Man, we've got loads of evidence!
C-circumstantial.
Sheesh. You better have a really good lawyer, Whydah.
Or, uh, whatever they have instead of lawyers for internal misconduct allegations.
Well, since you haven't done anything wrong, how about lending a hand?
You can helpfully point out some stuff we just happened to miss, right?
...I'm- I'm fulfilling my professional obli- obligations, just by being here.
C'mon, don't be like that!
I mean, it's not over yet. You still have time to fool us and make us solve it wrong!
You... what?
Just do what I do!
Come up with a bunch of ridiculous theories about what happened...
And pester Leo with them until he gets sick of explaining why you're wrong, and runs with one!
You- w-wait, you...?
I- no. I- I think I'd rather keep my dignity.
Pfffff. ''Dignity''. What'd dignity ever do for me?
